intro: Sanguisorba spinosa, commonly known as spiked sandwort, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its upright, spiky growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Sanguisorba spinosa is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other damp environments.
